definition: habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature/same as 習慣成自然|习惯成自然
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature/same as 習慣成自然|习惯成自然

sentences.english: Many people still cling to the old customs and beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 许多人仍然固守旧习惯和信仰。

sentences.english: Again, let him get used to the fastened halter for several days.
sentences.chinese: 再次，让他习惯了被系阿尔泰了好几天。

sentences.english: The small chin deformity was a common developmental deformity of the jaw.
sentences.chinese: “地包天”牙是颌骨发育畸形或不良习惯所引起。

sentences.english: In the end, the workers became used to doing hard work.
sentences.chinese: 最后，工人们终于习惯于干苦活了。

sentences.english: The third part of the study focused on the status of vocational school students bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分集中考察职校生不良行为习惯的现状。

sentences.english: If you expect the rainbow, you must first be used to experiencing storm.
sentences.chinese: 如果你期盼彩虹，那就应习惯承受风雨。

sentences.english: Cunard Line continues to provide the classy elegance we are accustomed to seeing from them.
sentences.chinese: 丘纳德线继续提供经典优雅我们习惯于看到他们。

sentences.english: As an employee, you may be used to operating in a "head-down" position;
sentences.chinese: 作为一名员工，你可能习惯于被领导的位置。

sentences.english: I do everything by habit one.
We ought not to need the exhortation: it should be our constant habit all the day and every day.
sentences.chinese: 这应该是基督徒每日的习惯，无需特别耳提面命。

sentences.english: Lleras based his theory on the idea that our senses become used to stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 雷若斯的理论是以我们感官会习惯的外来刺激为根据。

sentences.english: This part try to find the Tornatore's habits of direction and personal characteristics from the video shoot.
sentences.chinese: 从短片中找寻托纳托雷的拍摄习惯和个人导演特色。

sentences.english: Reportedly, the Chinese people in a New Year's Eve see the old habits.
sentences.chinese: 据称，中国民间在除夕有守岁的习惯。

sentences.english: They didn't develop those habits of mind by following mandated curricula.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有开发这些头脑的思维习惯强制遵循课程。

sentences.english: It's a good habit to wash up before a meal.
sentences.chinese: 饭前洗手洗脸是好习惯。

sentences.english: Eating caveman style is about PRINCIPLES.
sentences.chinese: 穴居人的饮食习惯就是遵守原则。

definition: to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
over time/as time passes/in the fullness of time
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
